data.title: Debugging Socket.io failes
Variable substitution problem in tasks.json when Integrating with MATLAB Command Window
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.7.2 (7ba55c5860b152d999dda59393ca3ebeb1b5c85f, 2016-11-21T22:06:37.428Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|matlab|Gimly81|0.4.0|

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Install the matlab extension by Gimly81 and set up linter path.
2. Configure the tasks.json file as:
```
{
    // See https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=733558
    // for the documentation about the tasks.json format
    "version": "0.1.0",
    "command": "matlab",
    "isShellCommand": true,
    "args": ["-nosplash", "-nodesktop", "-r", "${fileBasename}"],
    "showOutput": "always",
    "echoCommand": true,
    "suppressTaskName": true,
    "tasks": [
        {
            "taskName": "Run Matlab"
        }
    ]
}
```
3. Write a .m script file, and saved as **testForTask.m**. Such as:
```
[X,Y,Z] = peaks(25);
figure;
surf(X,Y,Z);
```
4. Run this task and the output pannel shows:
`running command> matlab -nosplash -nodesktop -r testForTask.m`
The Matlab Command Window shows:
`Undefined variable "testForTask" or function "testForTask.m".`
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/19483441/20647538/9b5b7a0c-b4d1-11e6-84cf-de669415404b.png)
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/19483441/20647543/a984b49a-b4d1-11e6-9306-574d51d0de26.png)

All required files have been on the MATLAB search path.

---

Reason:
From Matlab Help:

> Execute MATLAB Script or Function
> Execute the MATLAB statement, specified as a string or as the name of a MATLAB script or function. If statement is MATLAB code, enclose the string with double quotation marks. If statement is the name of a MATLAB function or script, do not specify the file extension and do not use quotation marks. Any required file must be on the MATLAB search path or in the startup folder.
> Example: `-r "disp(['Current folder: ' pwd])"`
> Example: `-r myscript`
> 

ATTENTION: When use a script as a argument, **Do NOT include its file extension. But in vscode, ${fileBasename} include the file extension**, we can see in the first image.

When I change the tasks.json into `"args": ["-nosplash", "-nodesktop", "-r", "testForTask"]`, it works well.
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/19483441/20647646/ae318fbc-b4d2-11e6-9c7e-b1b1f80e7bfe.png)
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/19483441/20647648/b70b8cdc-b4d2-11e6-8303-a69ef1127721.png)

Nobody will change the task.json every time they write a new .m file. Can anybody help?

data.title: Feature request: Call Hierarchy
data.body:
A call hierarchy of a function invocation is a very useful tool to quickly navigate in code. In VSCode I find my self using "Find Reference" repeatedly to do what I do with a call hierarchy in IDEs (Eclipse, IntelliJ).

UI-wise I think it could fit nicely with how "Find References" is done, but of course we would need to have a tree on the right hand side and the labels need to display the reference containing function definitions.

Conceptually it is close to a type hierarchy, which is requested in #15533.

data.title: Fuzzy Match for word based suggestions
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8 insider
What I do need is:
Fuzzy Match could work for "editor.wordBasedSuggestions", whatever the language is.

That is:
If GoodMorning, fooo_barr,  VisualStudioCode, TempVar1, tempvar2 ...in the context, as words, varablies,  function names or even just the comments
Then Typing:
gm  |  gom  |  goom  →all match→  GoodMorning 
fb    |  fob    |  foba    →all match→  fooo_barr
VSC |  vsc    |  visc     →all match→  VisualStudioCode
...
Of course, the suggestions' lists ordered by the matching accuracies.
This is very very useful in Sublime, and  hungry for it in VSC.

Thanks for the great tool ---VSC!

data.title: Fix backslash is not escaped by define key binding
data.body:
When defining keybinding using backslash key (with Define Keybinding feature), it will insert unescaped backslash:

```
"key": "shift+cmd+\",
```

This PR fixes it!

data.title: TypeScript debugger does not stop at breakpoint after blank line at the beginning of the file
data.body:
TypeScript debugger skips the breakpoint if you set them after blank new line at the beginning of the file.

- VSCode Version: 1.7.2
- OS Version: Windows 10 Pro

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create new index.ts
2. Copy the following typescript code

```javascript
// Intentional blank line goes after this line

hello()
hello()
hello()

function hello() {
  return 'hello'
}
```

Make sure you write the first `hello()` on the third line (the second line is empty)

3. Compile it with `tsc --sourceMap index.ts`
4. Configure debugger launch settings with

```json
{
  "type": "node",
  "request": "launch",
  "name": "Launch Program",
  "program": "${workspaceRoot}\\index.ts",
  "cwd": "${workspaceRoot}",
  "outFiles": [],
  "sourceMaps": true
}
```

5. Set breakpoints on `hello()` function call (all of them)
6. Run the debugger session

You will see that the breakpoint will stop at the second `hello()` function call, not the first one. I've already test the breakpoint with the compiled js file and it correctly stops at the first call. I don't know if this is the internal Node.js source mapping problem or the VSCode debugger integration problem.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9102276/20646462/828b9064-b4ab-11e6-911b-00ecad01661f.png)

data.title: Go to definition doesn't store the cursor location when the definition is in the same file
data.body:
After #11727 was fixed, doing 'go to definition' then 'back', would put the cursor in the correct location. But I just noticed that it still has the original behavior if the definition is in the same file as the starting position.

- Open some file `a.ts`
- Put the cursor on a reference to something that is defined in `a.ts`
- Do 'go to definition'
- Do 'back'
- See that the cursor is not on the reference, but somewhere earlier in its navigation history

data.title: [Groovy] file highlighting not correct for certain functions
data.body:

Mostly what happens is some functions are highlighted blue instead of white like other functions and definitions.  It seems like it happens only on variable definitions, but I've seen it at random places anywhere in a file. data.title: Cannot read property 'length' of undefined when expanding selection on an empty line
data.body:
- VSCode Version: `1.7.2`
- OS Version: `MacOS 10.12.1`

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a new Rust source code file.
2. Enter the code:
```
enum Foo {

}
```
3. Place cursor on the empty line between the curly braces.
4. Ctrl-Shift-Cmd-Right to expand selection.
5. Get "WARN Cannot read property 'length' of undefined" message.

data.title: Diagnostics are displayed out of order in Problems panel

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body: - VSCode Version: `1.7.2` and `1.8.0` - OS Version: `10.12.1` Steps to Reproduce: 1. Set the following diagnostics: ```typescript diagnostics.set( document.uri, [ new vs.Diagnostic(new vs.Range(0, 0, 1, 0), "first: a"), new vs.Diagnostic(new vs.Range(0, 0, 1, 0), "first: b"), new vs.Diagnostic(new vs.Range(0, 0, 1, 0), "first: b"), new vs.Diagnostic(new vs.Range(0, 0, 1, 0), "first: 0"), new vs.Diagnostic(new vs.Range(0, 0, 1, 0), "first: 0"), new vs.Diagnostic(new vs.Range(0, 0, 1, 0), "first: 1"), new vs.Diagnostic(new vs.Range(0, 0, 1, 0), "first: 1"), new vs.Diagnostic(new vs.Range(0, 0, 1, 0), "first: 2"), new vs.Diagnostic(new vs.Range(0, 0, 1, 0), "first: 2"), new vs.Diagnostic(new vs.Range(0, 0, 1, 0), "first: 3"), new vs.Diagnostic(new vs.Range(0, 0, 1, 0), "first: 3"), new vs.Diagnostic(new vs.Range(2, 0, 3, 0), "second: a"), new vs.Diagnostic(new vs.Range(2, 0, 3, 0), "second: b"), new vs.Diagnostic(new vs.Range(2, 0, 3, 0), "second: b"), new vs.Diagnostic(new vs.Range(2, 0, 3, 0), "second: 0"), new vs.Diagnostic(new vs.Range(2, 0, 3, 0), "second: 0"), new vs.Diagnostic(new vs.Range(2, 0, 3, 0), "second: 1"), new vs.Diagnostic(new vs.Range(2, 0, 3, 0), "second: 1"), new vs.Diagnostic(new vs.Range(2, 0, 3, 0), "second: 2"), new vs.Diagnostic(new vs.Range(2, 0, 3, 0), "second: 2"), new vs.Diagnostic(new vs.Range(2, 0, 3, 0), "second: 3"), new vs.Diagnostic(new vs.Range(2, 0, 3, 0), "second: 3"), new vs.Diagnostic(new vs.Range(4, 0, 5, 0), "third: a"), new vs.Diagnostic(new vs.Range(4, 0, 5, 0), "third: b"), new vs.Diagnostic(new vs.Range(4, 0, 5, 0), "third: b"), new vs.Diagnostic(new vs.Range(4, 0, 5, 0), "third: 0"), new vs.Diagnostic(new vs.Range(4, 0, 5, 0), "third: 0"), new vs.Diagnostic(new vs.Range(4, 0, 5, 0), "third: 1"), new vs.Diagnostic(new vs.Range(4, 0, 5, 0), "third: 1"), new vs.Diagnostic(new vs.Range(4, 0, 5, 0), "third: 2"), new vs.Diagnostic(new vs.Range(4, 0, 5, 0), "third: 2"), new vs.Diagnostic(new vs.Range(4, 0, 5, 0), "third: 3"), new vs.Diagnostic(new vs.Range(4, 0, 5, 0), "third: 3"), ], ); ``` The diagnostics shown in the problems panel are not ordered as expected. For example, the `a` and `b` items for the `first` and `third` have been moved to a different position. /cc @jonsterling

data.title: Content provided by TextDocumentContentProvider times out even when visible in the peek UI
data.body:
- VSCode Version: `1.8.0-insider (1.8.0-insider)` 0b847998d914ff84fd9c13b2972cc8803745c24d
- OS Version: macOS Sierra `10.12.1 (16B2555)`

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Have a `TextDocumentContentProvider` provide content that will be shown in the reference peek UI (Can use [GitLens](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=eamodio.gitlens) and open either the blame or file history explorer)
2. Wait for a bit and observe that the content in the left pane of the peek UI just disappears

Originally referenced here: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/11360

data.title: CodeLens toggles on/off on each keystroke when attached to a blank line
data.body:
- VSCode Version: `1.8.0-insider (1.8.0-insider)` 0b847998d914ff84fd9c13b2972cc8803745c24d
- OS Version: macOS Sierra `10.12.1 (16B2555)`

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a file with the first line of the file blank
2. Use an extension ([GitLens](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=eamodio.gitlens) works) that will add a CodeLens to the top of the file (i.e. to the blank line)
3. Start typing -- each keystroke will cause the CodeLens to disappear and reappear, but only this one CodeLens, any others will remain stable.

Can see animated gifs of the behavior here: https://github.com/eamodio/vscode-gitlens/issues/19

data.title: Exclude a subdirectory from the explorer using exact path does not work
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.2
- OS Version: Windows 10 Pro

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a directory `public` with a subdirectory `bundle`
2. Create a `settings.json` file under the `.vscode` directory
3. Add the following json to the `settings.json` file
```
{
  "files.exclude": {
    "public/bundle": true
  }
}
```
4. The bundle directory is still visible

Note that using `"public/*bundle": true`, or `"public/bundle*": true` or `"public/**/bundle": true` correctly hide the subdirectory.

data.title: Show diff between files and folders inside code
data.body:
Hi, 
I have idea, i dont know if anyone is willing to develop the extension in vscode or code itself provide such feature yet.

I am using **araxis merge** in my work, the way i work i open two files side by side and it shows the difference, not only difference it allows to insert the difference text from file A to B and VICE Versa in just a simple click.

Another feature is when i add two folders side by side, it **opens the tree of both folders and subfolders side by side**, with the file name alongwith differences count. When i open that file it generates the difference i mentioned above.

It would be really helpful if any one create such extension in vscode, and team could remove the blocking points by adding such features like folder tree view in one tab and other tabl - side by side may be.

I wish i could develop this extension but due to unavailability of time and managing my code sync extension i wont be able to develop this. :) 

Thanks,
Shan
